ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 43
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been having some horrible luck improving my skill.  My skill is in the 100s, and I have been making medium sized banded armor with a high-elf.  Most
ygData.messageBody:
I have been having some horrible luck improving my skill. My skill
is in the 100s, and I have been making medium sized banded armor
with a high-elf. Most stuff except for leggings is fairly easy, but
leggings take about 5 tries on average.

The problem is that my skill
very rarely goes up. I have made about 150 attempts at banded
armor, and it has only improved twice. Am I not holding my tongue
right or something? I'm using store bought water/metal sheets/molds.
Does it matter if I have the smithing books in my inventory?

Skewers are still helping, but it is more and more rare on those also.
Is there any nonbanded items that help after skewers?

-------

In other trades, does anyone know any pottery items more difficult
than Large Bowls? How about Brews harder than Ol'Tujims?

Elaari

>
> From: Steven Le <svietnam@...>
>
> At 11:04 AM 6/28/99 -0000, you wrote:
>
> > Date: Sun, 27 Jun 1999 19:36:29 CDT
> > From: Henning Seljenes <hseljenes@...>
> >Subject: Raising from level 26
> >
> >I can get to level 26 in smithing pretty easily. After this I have heard a
> >few ways to raise skills here. Skewers, (skalers?), or large lanterns. I
>
> Well I would use scalers till the 40's, I heard they work just as good but
> less fails so you make back some money. After that start skewers till it
> no longer gives you skill(90`s). After skwers no longer give you skill
> start trying banded gorgets, I heard they are the easiest. Stick with
> things that only need one sheet metal, then move to things that need two
> sheet metal and so on....
>
> Now large lanterns, from what I have heard, can be uses insted of the
> skewer stage. They seem to make more money back. You make large lanterns
> till skill 70`s then you start on the skewers when you get to the 90`s. By
> this time most ammor pieces should be easy.
>
> >want to know which way is the most effective but does not cost so much
> >money. I hear all kinds of differant opinions, and I just wanted some
> >information. If someone on Xegony could give me character a /tell (Irontoe),
> >or just send me an e-mail back.
> >
> >Irontoe Peacebringer - Paladin of Justice
> >
> BTW. Didn't I tell this to you already?
